JobFullDesc: Microsoft’s Cloud business is experiencing explosive growth, and the Capacity, Supply Chain & Provisioning (CSCP) organization is responsible for enabling the infrastructure underlying this growth. Our mission is to deliver the world’s computer with an industry-leading supply chain. CSCP is responsible for strategic sourcing, customer demand forecasting, capacity planning and management, supply chain planning and execution, capacity provisioning, and decommissioning and dispositioning of datacenter assets worldwide. The CSCP Executive Office strives to enable CSCP to excel as a world-class supply chain through communication, program management, governance, and organizational health. We are looking for a Communications Director to join the Executive Office reporting to the Chief of Staff (CoS). This candidate will work with internal stakeholders and other communicators to help craft our data narrative and showcase how it maps into the company’s Cloud efforts for customer capacity. We are looking for a skilled communicator who can translate complex technologies and concepts into simplified language and can extend storytelling to technology, consumer, and business press as well as social sharing. If you’re passionate and knowledgeable about the forefront of tech and supply chain innovation and want to be on the front lines of some of the most demanding and high priority efforts in the company, then we want to talk to you.Responsibilities• Lead development of our industry-leading supply chain narrative broadly and help communicate our impact and translate that narrative across mediums in a compelling and impactful way• Build relationship with Corporate PR team to bring CSCP stories into Microsoft’s overall narratives & pitch ideas for engagement• Develop CVP communications content for key external audiences, including customers and business decision makers• Write speeches, blogs, LinkedIn posts and articles, press quotes, social media content, video scripts, and other talking points and digital content• Demonstrate the ability to think and conceptualize in the digital medium to develop creative concepts for digital events and presentations• Manage and evaluate incoming speaking requests to determine and manage appropriate format, content, and deliverables end-to-end with key stakeholders• Proactively seek out CVP speaking and authorship opportunities aligned to thought leadership priorities• Research subject matter and find the most impactful stories and synthesize talking points and messaging from other teams• Measure the outcomes of engagements to evaluate impact, learn and improve• Build high quality PR and social media content and materials. • Align messaging with external communications across business groups and functional areas• Work closely with business, communications, marketing and engineering counterparts across the company as a trusted partner and advisor. • Manage and develop spokespeople, including senior executives. Coordinate customer and partner references and stories.• Be an integral part of the CSCP Executive Office team, collaborating across shared goals, projects and activities.QualificationsRequired Qualifications:• BA/BS in Journalism, Marketing or Communications or 4+ years equivalent industry experience• 7+ years communications, public relations, marketing, or executive communications experience Preferred Qualifications:• 15+ communications, public relations, marketing, or executive communications experience• Supply Chain knowledge and experience • External communication background with experience in Strategy or Technology marketing and communications • Exceptional storytelling via messaging and writing skills to demonstrate a journey toward a world-class capability• Experience working with research analysts to influence industry and grow recognition• Ability to leverage multiple channels to land meaningful communications (events, video, social, etc.)• Knowledge of graphic design and multi-media creative (PowerPoint, Sway, videos, etc.)• Great attention to detail and ensures accuracy in all communications deliverables, regularity and adherence to deadlines for Rhythm of Business (ROB)• Strong cross-group collaboration skills and ability to drive coordination across all levels and stakeholders• Growth mindset and a pre-disposition to learning culture• Ability to manage multiple communication projects simultaneously and drive strong work-back plans• Thrive in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment and ability to adapt plans and approaches real-time to meet business needs• Business maturity and experience in working with senior executives, and the ability to work independently; seeking guidance, coaching and assistance from both direct leadership and CVP as needed• Ability to see the big picture to determine how the fine details fit the broader strategy #CSCPJobs Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer.
